{% extends "_layouts/skeleton.html" %} {% set content %} # Placeholder images Prontotype has a simple, built-in placeholder image generation service so that you don't need to rely on third party image generation sites. And by using the [placeholder image snippet]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('tref-snippets-assets') }}#snippets-assets-placeholder) to generate the `img` tag you'll also gain the ability to switch out to one of server popular external services with a single configuration change, too. Using the [placeholder image snippet]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('tref-snippets-assets') }}#snippets-assets-placeholder) it's as easy as this: {% raw %}
{{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder() }}
{% endraw %} That will output an image that looks like this: {{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder() }} Of course, you probably want to customise a few things about the image, like the size, background colour etc. To do that you can pass in an array of options, like so: {% raw %}
{{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder({
    'width': 400,                   
    'height': 150,             
    'bgcolor': '88b286', 
    'color': 'fff', 
    'text': 'My first image', 
}) }}
{% endraw %} Which will output the following image: {{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder({ 'width': 400, 'height': 150, 'bgcolor': '88b286', 'color': 'fff', 'text': 'My first image' }) }} ## Specifying an alternative service If you wish to use a third party placeholder images service, you can either set it on a global basis or specify it on a per-image basis. To globaly change the service used you can set it in [your configuration file]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('config') }}) as follows: 
snippets:
  assets:
    placeholder:
      service: lorempixel # can be any one of 'prontotype', 'dummyimage', 'placeholdit', 'lorempixel', 'placekitten'
All placeholder image tags generated with the [placeholder image snippet]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('tref-snippets-assets') }}#snippets-assets-placeholder) will be instantly switched over to use the chosen service without you having to update you templates. You can also set the service on a per-image tag basis (useful if you just want one placeholder image of a particular type), by specifying the service as one of the options, like so: {% raw %}
{{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder({
    'service' : 'placekitten'
}) }}
{% endraw %} {{ pt.snippets.assets.placeholder({ 'service' : 'placekitten' }) }} ### Supported services: * Prontotype (built-in): `prontotype` * [Dummy Image](http://dummyimage.com): `dummyimage` * [Placehold.it](http://placehold.it): `placeholdit` * [Lorem Pixel](http://lorempixel.com): `lorempixel` * [Placekitten](http://placekitten.com): `placekitten`

Note that not all services support all customisation options (like text, category etc). If the service doesn't support a specified option it will just be ignored.
